Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • Character

  • public class Character
extends java.lang.Object
    AN instance of Character will hold any data about a character, including it's state, it's coordiantes on the map and it's inventory.
    Creation Date: 20/11/19.
    Last Modification Date: 6/12/19.
    Version:
    1.7
    Author:
    Timothy Roger (977422), Nihal Goindi (976005)

      • draw

        public void draw(java.lang.String IMAGE_FOLDER,
                 javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                 int x,
                 int y)
        Draws the character onto the passed GraphicsContext at the passed coordinates
        Parameters:
        IMAGE_FOLDER - String - the path to the correct image folder.
        gc - GraphicsContext - used to draw the Images.
        x - int - X coordinate.
        y - int - Y coordinate

        Parameters:

        public int[] getCoords()
        Get the coordinates of the character.
        Returns:
        the small array of integers that contain the coordinates.

      • setCoords

        public void setCoords(int[] coords)
        Sets the character's coordinates to the passed value.
        Parameters:
        coords - int[] - array of two integers which are the new X and Y coordinates.
